title: IT-specialist med ansvar för Microsoft 365 till  Ersta diakoni
description:
**Om arbetsplatsen**
 Ersta diakoni är Sveriges största idéburna aktör inom vård och omsorg. Vi bedriver sjukvård, socialt arbete, forskning och utbildning, professionellt och utan vinstsyfte.
   

  

 Hos oss blir du en del av ett IT-team på cirka 15 personer, bestående främst av tekniker och systemförvaltare. Samarbetet mellan våra olika roller är en naturlig del av vardagen. Vi har en prestigelös kultur där vi stöttar varandra, delar kunskap och hjälps åt. Vi tror på att lyfta varandra och skapar tillsammans en arbetsmiljö som präglas av gemenskap, engagemang och utveckling – både som team och individuellt.
   

  

 Som medarbetare hos oss erbjuder vi en rad förmåner som vi hoppas ska ge dig förutsättningar att trivas på jobbet och ha en givande fritid.
   

  

**Om rollen**
 I den här rollen blir du vår specialist inom området och har en viktig roll i att utveckla och säkra en modern, effektiv och stabil IT-miljö. Du kommer att:
   

  

* vara tekniskt ansvarig för vår Microsoft 365-miljö med fokus på Teams, OneDrive och relaterade tjänster
* arbeta med säkerhet, administration och konfiguration i Intune, Entra ID och Microsoft Defender
* ha ett särskilt fokus på att stärka vår säkerhet i Microsoft-miljön
* hantera mer komplexa ärenden och agera expertstöd vid behov
* bidra till utveckling och förbättring av våra IT-lösningar
* arbeta även med andra verksamhetskritiska system – som exempelvis sjukhusets vårdsystem och administrativa plattformar
* på sikt delta i strategiska initiativ och projekt inom exempelvis IT-automatisering och verksamhetsnära digitalisering.


**Vem är du?**
 För att lyckas i den här rollen ser vi att du:
   

  

* trivs med att arbeta tillsammans med andra för att lösa utmaningar – du bidrar med din kunskap och är prestigelös i ditt samarbete
* har god förmåga att arbeta självständigt, prioritera och driva ditt område framåt utan att alltid ha färdiga instruktioner
* är nyfiken, ansvarstagande och har en vilja att lära dig mer – både om tekniken och om verksamheten
* har ett strukturerat arbetssätt och en analytisk förmåga som hjälper dig att lösa problem effektivt
* kommunicerar tydligt och har förmåga att förklara teknik för olika målgrupper.


 Du delar Erstas värdegrund om att se hela människan och våra värdeord; professionalism, tillit och hopp.
   

  

**Din erfarenhet**
 Vi söker dig som har:
   

  

* gedigen erfarenhet inom Microsoft 365 och relaterade tjänster
* erfarenhet av Microsoft Active Directory (AD)
* intresse och gärna erfarenhet av säkerhetslösningar inom Microsofts ekosystem
* erfarenhet av Intune, säkerhetsfunktioner och enhetshantering.


 Vi ser positivt på om du har erfarenhet från vård, omsorg eller annan samhällsnära verksamhet.
   

  

**Övrigt om rekryteringen**
 Urval sker löpande och tjänsten kan komma att tillsättas innan sista ansökningsdag.
   

  

 Vi tillämpar provanställning som standard.
   

  

 Kontaktperson: Robert Rangdang, Gruppchef, robert.rangdang@erstadiakoni.se
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-05-19
   

  

*Observera att vi inte tar emot ansökningar via e-post.*
 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Head of Data Management Division based in Luxembourg
description:
**This position is based at our Luxembourg headquarters and requires regular office presence.** 
 The EIB offers you the opportunity to live and work in a truly international and multi-cultural environment. We also offer relocation support. The
 **EIB** 
 , the European Union's bank, is seeking to recruit for its Group Corporate Services Directorate – Group Digital Office (GCS-GDO), Data & Information Solutions Department (DIS), Data Management Division (DM) at its headquarters in Luxembourg, a
 **Head of Data Management Division** 
**\*.**
**This is a full-time position at grade 7 for which the EIB offers a permanent contract.**
* internal benchmark Division Head IT Applications


***Applicants will receive an initial feedback in May 2025.***
***Assessment Centers for selected applicants would take place in June 2025.***
***Panel interviews are anticipated for June/July 2025.***
 Purpose
   

  

 You will be at the heart of the organization's data transformation journey, ensuring everything aligns with business goals, IT strategies, and architecture principles. Your leadership will unlock the full potential of data through strategic guidance, governance, and innovative AI and analytics.
   

  

 You'll develop and implement a comprehensive EIB Group Data strategy that focuses on data collection, reporting, dashboarding, analytics, and AI. This strategy will empower better decision-making, enhance data quality, boost our technology capabilities, and drive efficiency gains—all while helping the EIBG’ business achieve its objectives.
   

  

 Every day, you’ll deliver high-quality, reliable, and "right on time" data services across the EIB Group, enabling teams to take action, make informed decisions, and drive impactful outcomes.
   

  

 Operating Network
   

  

 The Data Management Division’s role is to manage a common foundation of high-quality data to facilitate optimal, secure, and compliant solutions across business areas. This includes managing and governing data collection, reporting, dashboarding, analytics, and artificial intelligence solutions to benefit business services.
   

  

 The Head of Division reports to the Head of Data Information Solution Department and work closely with the other Heads of Divisions in GDO, with business users who are involved in projects and initiatives led by the Division.
   

  

 Accountabilities
   

  

* Provide input and proactively contribute to the development of an overall IT strategy for the EIB Group, ensuring alignment with the organization's business strategy and external IT trends and developments. Develop and refine policies for the data management domain.
* Drive data-driven decision-making by collaborating with IT teams and business units.
* Ensure data security, privacy, and regulatory compliance by implementing industry best practices, risk assessments, and cybersecurity measures to safeguard sensitive data assets.
* Ensure business value creation and maximize data value by integrating AI and analytics into core business functions to drive operational efficiency and better data valorisation.
* Lead and participate in organisation-wide transversal projects, working groups, internal committees, and fora as appropriate to ensure that best practices are taken into account.
* Recruit, lead, develop and retain highly qualified staff in a complex and fast-paced environment, fostering a high-performance, data-driven culture and ensuring continuous upskilling in emerging technologies while securing diversity and various expertise.
* Monitor and control the implementation of the projects/programmes in Data Management domain to ensuring timely and budget-compliant delivery that brings all foreseen business benefits.
* Provide leadership and guidance on complex issues to Division staff members, ensuring timely resolution of business issues while fostering a collaborative team environment within the division and with key stakeholders.
* Drive and deliver simplification of vendor landscape, shifting towards outcome-based service model incorporating also agile ways of working.
* Stay updated on market trends in the Data Management technology and service delivery models, testing and learning from new capabilities and scaling up competencies.


**Qualifications**
* University degree (minimum an equivalent to a Bachelor) preferably in computer science or information technology related domain.
* Minimum 10 years of experience managing large IT projects and supporting production solutions/services, with a focus on Data Warehousing, Data Lakes, Analytics, and AI/ML platforms.
* Experience in managing and coaching substantial internal and external teams, ideally within multicultural environments or international organizations (e.g., contribution to: determining team resources and skills; establishing objectives; assessing performance; delegating and supervising tasks; guiding, motivating, coaching and providing feedback), with a minimum of 5 years of experience in managing large teams.
* Extensive experience in delivering solutions in hybrid (on prem/cloud computing) environments for data warehousing, data lake, analytics and artificial intelligence.
* Business expertise preferably in banking industry (ideally investment banking) delivering data services, demonstrating knowledge and understanding of the financial sector and relevant products including understanding of core business activities of an Investment Bank.
* Demonstrated experience in managing vendors in outcome based and/or outsourcing services model, ensuring seamless collaboration with vendors also in T&M mode.
* Proven record of delivering complex projects and managing a portfolio of projects in ones area, evidenced by tangible results and effective use of various methodologies, including delivery leveraging scaled agile
* Demonstrated experience in managing and delivering daily critical IT services/operations adhering to ITIL best practices, driving preferably ‘shift left’ automation and devsecops practices would be an asset.
* Excellent knowledge of English and/or French (\*\*), with a good command of the other. (Knowledge of other EU languages especially French would be an advantage).


 Competencies
   

  

*Find out more about EIB core and managerial competencies* 
 here
   

  

 To find out more about our eligibility criteria click here
   

  

*(\*\*) Unless stated explicitly as a required qualification, a good command of French is not a pre-requisite for hire. As both English and French are however official working languages of the EIB, proficiency in both languages is a pre-requisite for your future career development. Any language clause in your contract must be fulfilled in order for you to be eligible for a promotion (either via the annual appraisal cycle or via an internal selection process). Proficiency is understood to mean the attainment of* 
*level 5 of the Inter Institutional language courses, corresponding to B1.2 of the Common European Framework of Reference for Languages (CEFRL). The Bank offers appropriate training support.*
 We hire and value talent with unique characteristics, creating a work environment where they can be themselves. We believe that Diversity, Equity and Inclusion makes us a performing and innovative organisation. We encourage all suitably qualified and eligible candidates to apply regardless of their gender identity/expression, age, racial, ethnic and cultural background, religion and beliefs, sexual orientation, disability or neurodiversity.
   

  

 We strongly invite applicants with a disability, neurodivergent profile or chronic condition to request reasonable accommodations at any stage during the recruitment process. Please contact the EIB Recruitment team Jobs@eib.org who will ensure that your request is handled.
   

  

 By applying for this position, you acknowledge the importance of maintaining the security and integrity of the Information of the EIB Group. In case of selection for the position you agree to comply with all measures (policies, controls, document classification and management) implemented by the EIB Group to prevent unauthorised disclosure of any information or any damage to the EIB Group reputation.
   

  

 Deadline for applications:
 ****11th May 2025****

title: IT-Forensiker
description:
*Vill du ta nästa steg i din karriär på ett av världens ledande revisions- och rådgivningsföretag? På PwC motiveras vi av att använda vår uppfinningsförmåga, erfarenhet och den senaste tekniken för att skapa värde för våra kunder. Drivet finns hos alla som jobbar hos oss och tillsammans löser vi komplexa uppgifter, utvecklar företag och har en positiv påverkan på samhället.*
**Bli en del av PwC:s utredningsteam**
 Som medarbetare inom PwC:s forensiska team stöttar du företag och organisationer inom den privata, offentliga och finansiella sektorn. Vårt tjänsteutbud innefattar bland annat utredningar, förebyggande arbete mot ekonomiska oegentligheter och penningtvätt, visselblåsarfunktioner, bakgrundskontroller, IT-forensik samt många andra tjänster ämnade åt att identifiera oegentligheter och stärka våra kunders organisationer. Dina arbetsdagar varierar med dina projekt, ena veckan arbetar du med att genomföra IT-forensisk datainsamling hos kund, för att nästa vecka genomföra en djupgående dataanalys på vårt kontor. Du arbetar alltid tillsammans med andra i ett gemensamt team för att stötta våra kunder att lösa sina utmaningar och skapa långsiktigt hållbara lösningar. Som företag handlar vårt arbete inte bara om våra kunder och medarbetare – vi vill även bidra till ett mer hållbart och rättvist samhälle för alla. Läs mer om våra tjänsteområden inom Forensic Services.
   

  

**Arbetsuppgifter**
 PwC:s forensiska team söker nu dig med minst två års erfarenhet inom IT-forensik som vill arbeta med forensiska utredningar. Arbetet inkluderar tekniska uppgifter som att säkra och bearbeta data från olika källor, samt att analysera och sammanställa komplex data. Arbetsuppgifterna varierar beroende på typen av utredning och kan skilja sig från projekt till projekt. Vi söker dig som trivs med både tekniskt arbete och andra aspekter av forensiska utredningar, och som uppskattar ett varierande arbete.
   

  

 PwC:s forensiska tjänster utgår främst från kontoret i Stockholm, så det är därför önskvärt att du bor i Stockholmsområdet eller är beredd att flytta/resa dit. Men då avdelningen befinner sig i en expansiv fas finns det dock även möjlighet att arbeta från något av våra kontor i Göteborg eller Malmö.
   

  

**Din profil**
 Vi söker en erfaren IT-forensiker med minst två års relevant arbetslivserfarenhet, gärna från Polisen eller en liknande myndighet.
   

  

 Du ska ha gedigen kunskap i att identifiera och spegla/extrahera data från relevanta datakällor med hjälp av etablerade forensiska verktyg och metoder. Dessutom förväntas du kunna utföra analyser baserade på vanligt förekommande IT-forensiska frågeställningar, såsom händelseloggsanalys samt återskapande av borttagen data.
   

  

 Erfarenhet av dataanalys och databashantering är mycket meriterande. Du har en stark förmåga att snabbt sätta dig in i nya tekniska systemlösningar och behärskar både svenska och engelska flytande, i både tal och skrift.
   

  

 Det är meriterande om du har utbildning eller certifiering inom IT-forensik, samt kunskaper i EnCase- eller eDiscovery-plattformar som exempelvis Relativity.
   

  

 Som person är du engagerad, en skicklig problemlösare och har lätt för att bygga relationer. Du är även ansvarstagande och lägger stor vikt vid att leverera goda resultat.
   

  

 ,
   

  

**Ansökan**
 Välkommen med din ansökan till oss senast den 31 maj 2025. Vi kommer att gå igenom ansökningarna löpande och tjänsten kan tillträdas tidigare än sista ansökningsdagen.
   

  

**Tillträde:** 
 Omgående enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Vi ber dig bifoga följande handlingar med din ansökan:
   

  

* CV
* Personligt brev


**Rekryteringsprocessen**
 Vi tror på styrkan i att ha en rekryteringsprocess som gäller för alla. Som en del av urvalet använder vi oss därför av arbetspsykologiska tester med syfte att säkerställa ett objektivt, fördomsfritt och rättvist urval. Testerna är ett första steg i vår urvalsprocess. Du får en länk till dessa när vi har tagit emot din ansökan.
   

  

 Vi värdesätter det personliga mötet för att se vilket värde just du kan tillföra PwC men också vad vi kan erbjuda dig. Intervjuprocessen består vanligtvis av flera steg och olika typer av intervjuer. När du träffar HR, har du en kompetensbaserad intervju där vi tittar på personlighetstestet som du genomfört innan intervjun. Vid intervjun med verksamheten får du möjlighet att träffa det aktuella teamet för att gå igenom rollen.
   

  

 Vi kallar till intervju löpande.
   

  

 För frågor gällande tjänsten eller rekryteringsprocessen vänligen kontakta ansvarig rekryterare.

title: Drifttekniker
description:
Det är på regeringens uppdrag som Statens fastighetsverk (SFV) förvaltar vårt gemensamma natur- och kulturarv. Vi förvaltar en mångfald av statligt ägda fastigheter – däribland regeringsbyggnader, domstolar, slott och kungsgårdar, teatrar, museer, ambassader samt en sjundedel av landets yta bestående av skog och mark.
   

  

 Som medarbetare är vi stolta över att vara anställda på en myndighet, arbeta utifrån den statliga värdegrunden och få bidra till en positiv samhällsutveckling.
   

  

**SFV Stockholm centralt** 
 förvaltar byggnader på bland annat Skepps- och Kastellholmen, Riddarholmen, Gamla stan samt på Djurgården. Bland våra hyresgäster finns bland annat myndigheter, museer samt restaurang- och hotellverksamhet. Våra fantastiska byggnader har alla en historia att berätta och lockar besökande från hela världen.
   

  

**Tjänsten**
 Vi är en grupp kollegor i varierande ålder med olika bakgrund som tillsammans bidrar till att långsiktigt vårda vårt gemensamma kulturarv. Som drifttekniker ansvarar du för driften i ett antal byggnader i tätt samarbete med övriga kollegor på fastighetsområdet. I unika miljöer och på marknadsmässiga villkor levererar vi tillsammans en förstklassig drift och förvaltning gentemot våra hyresgäster.
   

  

 Vårt arbete är väldigt varierande och omväxlande, den ena dagen är inte den andra lik. Exempel på arbetsuppgifter som ingår är tillsyn och skötsel, mediauppföljning och driftoptimering, SBA, avhjälpande underhåll samt medverkan i projekt.
   

  

 Det kan även ingå att ha ett områdesövergripande ansvar för vissa arbetsuppgifter, till exempel brandskyddssamordnare. Då beredskapstjänstgöring, med en timmes inställelsetid, kan bli aktuellt är B-körkort ett krav.
   

  

**Din profil**
 Vi söker dig som har en utbildning inom driftteknik eller motsvarande, alternativt har du skaffat dig likvärdig kompetens i arbetslivet. Vi ser det som meriterande om du har god kunskap om fastighetsautomation, mediauppföljning, driftoptimering samt systematiskt brandskyddsarbete. Då arbete i olika IT-system ingår i tjänsten krävs god datavana.
   

  

 Du uttrycker dig väl på svenska i både tal och skrift.
   

  

**Personliga egenskaper**
 För oss är dina personliga egenskaper viktiga då driften är SFV´s ansikte utåt. Du uppskattar det personliga mötet, gillar att skapa och underhålla personliga och yrkesmässiga kontakter med såväl hyresgäster, kollegor som entreprenörer.
   

  

 Som person är du nyfiken och gillar att ta egna initiativ för att hitta smarta lösningar som förbättrar våra arbetssätt. Att dela med dig av dina erfarenheter och kunskaper ser du som självklart.
   

  

 Du tar ansvar för dina arbetsuppgifter och driver ditt arbete framåt, både på egen hand och i grupp. Strukturerat arbetssätt samt ordning och reda är en förutsättning för att du ska lyckas i rollen. Att arbeta i kulturhistoriska miljöer är något du värdesätter och du har förståelse för de speciella krav som ställs.
   

  

**Mer information**
 Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning. SFV tillämpar 6 månaders provanställning.
   

  

 För frågor är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef Pierre Svanberg tfn 010-478 74 55.
   

  

 Fackliga representanter för Saco, Seko och OFR/S nås via vår växel, 010-478 70 00. Mer information om SFV hittar du på www.sfv.se
   

  

 Innan ett beslut om anställning fattas kan en säkerhetsprövning enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) komma att genomföras. Om anställningen avser befattning i säkerhetsklass kommer säkerhetsprövningen även att innefatta en registerkontroll och i vissa fall krävs svenskt medborgarskap.
   

  

 Statens fastighetsverk verkar inom branscher som är exponerade mot olika risker för oegentligheter, i förbyggande syfte förekommer därför tjänster där lämplighetsprövning genomförs.
   

  

 Sista ansökningsdag är 2025-05-04 och vi ser fram emot din ansökan och CV.
   

  

 Välkommen till oss!

title: Cloud Architect
description:
**Must Have Skills -** 
 AWS Infra Services, Azure Infra Services, Dell EMC VxRail, Kubernetes, Nutanix, RedHat Linux Administrator, Solaris 10 and 11 administration, VMWare ESXi, VMware-VxRail-HCI-Administration, Windows Server
 



  





**Preferred Skills? (but not mandatory/ Good to have skills) -** 
 AIX administration, GCP Infra Services, HPUX administration
 



  




* Hands on years’ experience as an IT Infrastructure Architect with focus on designing solutions in onprem and cloud platform
* Onprem and Cloud Architecture design implementation and migration experience
* horough understanding of cloud architectures PaaS IaaS SaaS
* Design and implement infrastructure environment provisioning PaaS and or entire application provisioning on cloud platforms
* Design and build containers along with deployment and management strategy
* Strong understanding across Cloud and infrastructure components server storage network data and applications to deliver end to end Cloud Infrastructure architectures and designs
* Maintain and Troubleshoot HA and DR implementations on Hosting platform OnPrem and Cloud
* Strong expertise in DevOps and CICD implementation
* Experience with onprem and cloud environment sizing disaster recovery architecture for applications
* Experience in leading a team applying all elements of Technical Consulting
* Experience in assessment of Infrastructure and Application using industry approved tools
* Good understanding of virtualization Cloud Services and operations Web Sites hosting
* Understand and can articulate the technical merits and value of Cloud and OnPrem computing
* Experience in enterprise applications solutions and data center infrastructures
* Experience in platform and cloud migrations including of Mass Migration Toolsets
* Ability to work with team members from around the globeexperience working with offshore models
* Excellent communication interpersonal skills

title: Category Sourcing Manager (IT & Software)
description:
**Why Join Us?** 




 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
 



  





 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
 



  





 As a Sourcing Manager, you will join our global Sourcing team, who is responsible for both project sourcing and strategic sourcing and supports all business units as a group function, including affiliate companies. In this role, you'll be managing and optimizing IT and software-related agreements, including enterprise software licenses, SaaS, IT services, infrastructure, and digital tools.
 



  





 You'll have the opportunity to work on both category and supplier management, driving cost efficiency, ensuring compliance, and aligning with IT and business needs. To support best-in-class supplier management and indirect sourcing processes, you'll collaborate closely with the IT department and key stakeholders across the organization.
 



  





**In this role, you will:** 



* Lead sourcing activities for IT and software, including enterprise software licenses, SaaS, IT services, and cloud solutions.
* Negotiate and manage software agreements, ensuring cost optimization, compliance, and risk mitigation.
* Run RFx processes to identify, evaluate, and select the best IT and software suppliers.
* Develop and implement supplier governance frameworks to track performance and drive continuous improvement.
* Ensure compliance with procurement policies, data security, and software license regulations.
* Build and maintain strong relationships with internal stakeholders to align sourcing strategies with IT and business needs.
* Manage supplier relationships to ensure service quality, cost efficiency, and contractual compliance.



  





**Please note:** 
 This role may include occasional (10%) domestic or international travel which would be communicated weeks in advance.
 



  





**What We're Looking For:** 




 We are looking for a sourcing professional with strong negotiation skills who has a solid grasp of IT and software sourcing to drive our
 **indirect sourcing activities.** 




  





**We are looking for someone that has:** 



* 3+ years of experience in sourcing, procurement, or vendor management roles within IT, software, or technology procurement.
* Experience with managing software license agreements, SaaS contracts or IT service agreements.
* Experience with running RFx processes and supplier evaluations for IT and software solutions.
* Foundational understanding of procurement methods, contract management, risk assessment, and supplier governance.
* Strong negotiation skills and ability to drive cost savings while ensuring high service quality.
* Proactivity, analytical mindset, and ability to work in a fast-paced environment.
* Excellent communication skills in English (both written and verbal) and ability to collaborate cross-functionally.



  





**Our Values:** 




 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
 



  





**What We Offer:** 




 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
 


* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: ERP Project Manager - Europe
description:
**Job Summary**
 Project Manager will play a pivotal role in successful implementation of new ERP in coordination with Nefab companies across Europe within the defined timeline.
   

  

**JOB LOCATION**
 Flexible within Europe - However, the person should be living / willing to relocate closer to any of Nefab sites / offices within Europe.
   

  

**KEY RESPONSIBLITIES**
* Together with the local project managers, plan the activities in one to two simultaneous projects.
* Be responsible to establish and follow up the project plan, activities, requirements, test scenarios and issues in the project tool using the Nefab ERP rollout methodology.
* Lead the implementation team and plan and coordinate central resources that is responsible to approve and ensure solutions are developed to approved gaps. Follow up that the different stake holders and ensure their tasks are done in a timely manner.
* Support the local project leader to prepare and drive local steering group meetings.
* Communicate progress with all stakeholders in the ERP organization.
* Drive so that decisions are taken in a timely manner.
* Acts as liaison and coordinator of input from the subject matter experts, other ERP Analysts and the core team.


**Qualification & Experience**
* You have an university degree (Bachelor) within Business Administration, finance, manufacturing, supply chain or equivalent
* Two to five years of relevant working experience, preferably within manufacturing industry and experience in project management


**COMPETENCES**
* You are structured and have the ability to pay close attention to details
* Good communication skills
* Leadership abilities
* Project Management
* Ability to build strong relationships with team members
* Ability to maintain a positive attitude and a sense of humor in stressful situations
* Critical and analytical thinking, where you have the ability to analyze situations, identify problems and propose and get acceptance for new ways of working
* Ability to stay calm and patient in stressful situations
* You can easily understand new IT systems.


**Company Values And Ways Of Working**
 Our core values are Simplicity, Empowerment and Respect. Our ways of working are characterized by Customer First, Cooperation and Communication. This means that we are always putting customers first, through cooperation and communication. We respect each other and the environment. People are empowered to grow and innovate to simplify.
   

  

**Application**
 Impress us with your CV/resume and motivational letter, written in English, no later than May 10, 2025.
   

  

 Nefab is an equal opportunity employer, embracing diversity and inclusion. We are committed to building teams with a variety of backgrounds, perspectives and skills. We believe everyone has talent and therefore welcome all applications.

title: OT Security Consultant
description:
**About Us**
 We are the independent expert in assurance and risk management. Driven by our purpose, to safeguard life, property, and the environment, we empower our customers and their stakeholders with facts and reliable insights so that critical decisions can be made with confidence.
   

  

 As a trusted voice for many of the world’s most successful organizations, we use our knowledge to advance safety and performance, set industry benchmarks, and inspire and invent solutions to tackle global transformations.
   

  

**About The Accelerator**
 We rapidly nurture successful businesses and services that will shape the future of assurance. The Accelerator operates a portfolio of units undergoing significant growth, chiefly through acquisitions and partnerships. The Accelerator acts as a greenhouse for a strategically selected portfolio of businesses, each of which serves different industries and markets. The portfolio benefits from dedicated support to rapidly grow through organic means, as well as through acquisitions and partnerships. Three business units were housed in the Accelerator in 2022: Cyber Security, Digital Health, and Inspection.
   

  

**About The Role**
 DNV has significant ambitions to grow the Cyber Security unit in the coming years. Building on our success and strengths in the Nordics and internationally we will make a global impact on safeguarding life, property and the environment.
   

  

 We are currently looking for talented
 **OT Security Consultants** 
 to join our growing Industrial & OT Cyber Security unit. This team provides cyber security assessments, technical verification and advisory services both onshore and offshore. You will be working on exciting customer projects in key industries including maritime, oil and gas, renewables, utilities and others.
   

  

 This role will offer you the opportunity to work alongside some of the most experienced specialists in the Industrial cyber security field. We aim to provide you with a fast-paced career that brings you opportunities to develop your competencies rapidly. We will invest in your career development, offering in-depth training and the chance to participate in industry-leading courses and projects.
   

  

**You will be based at one of our DNV offices in The Netherlands, Germany or Sweden.**
**Job Requirements**
 Broad general knowledge on OT applications and infrastructure with specific knowledge on several of the following:
   

  

* OT/IT Networks (switches, routing, firewalls)
* Must have experience working in an automation engineer background
* Firewall rules, logging, monitoring, IDS/IPS & troubleshooting (Checkpoint & Palo Alto)
* Enabling services (e.g NTP, SMTP, patching, AntiVirus)
* System integration technologies (OPC, XML, middleware)
* Server infrastructure (VMWare ESXi, storage)


**For More Information About The Position, Please Contact**
 Head of unit, Industrial and OT systems, Svante Einarsson at svante.einarsson@dnv.com
   

  

 What we offer
   

  

**What We Offer**
* Strong company culture with an emphasis on competence development
* Great colleagues who value teamwork and support
* International working environment
* Exciting projects within critical sectors locally and internationally
* Competitive terms and conditions
* Flexible working hours and a focus on work/life balance
* Social events, sports and team building activities


 DNV is an Equal Opportunity Employer and gives consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to gender, religion, race, national or ethnic origin, cultural background, social group, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, age or political opinion. Diversity is fundamental to our culture and we invite you to be part of this diversity.
   

  

**About You**
**What You Bring:**
* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or a related technical field
* Minimum of 4+ years’ work experience in Operational Technology Security
* Expertise on securing OT network architecture
* Experience as an Automation / Controls Engineer
* Excellent presentation, written and verbal communication skills; ability to clearly communicate and have excellent consulting skills
* Ability to interact with high profile clients
* GICSP, CISSP, CISM or CFSE/CFSP certification.
* Fluent language skills in English and at least one additional European language
* Willingness to travel for approx. 25% of your time


 We work with clients that are related to critical infrastructure. A qualified candidate must be able to pass a screening background check.

title: Senior Systemutvecklare
description:
Vi har nu ett nytt behov och söker därför en konsultkollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd av oss och arbetar hos kund alt. interna projekt och åtaganden.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
* Progress OpenEdge
* ABL, DB, AppServer, WSA
* WS/SOPA
* SQL
* .NET (C#, ASP, IIS Azure)
* Apache Tomcat
* XML


**Meriterande**
* API:er/intergrationer


**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 08-05-2025
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag erfarna konsulter, inom bl.a. Systemutveckling, Test, Arkitektur, IT-Projektledning, IT-Säkerhet.
   

  

 Att jobba på Deploja är något helt annat än att arbeta på ett vanligt konsultbolag – och det är vi riktigt stolta över. Vad är det då som gör oss unika?
   

  

 Vi erbjuder helt enkelt mer än bara hög lön och större frihet, det är bara början. Hos oss hittar du den arbetsmiljö och de möjligheter du förtjänar. Välkommen till Deploja, där gräset faktiskt är grönare!
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester, kanske 60 dagar?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Technology/Climate technology Underwriter
description:
Chubb is a world leader in insurance. With operations in 54 countries and territories, Chubb provides commercial and personal property and casualty insurance, personal accident and supplemental health insurance, reinsurance and life insurance to a diverse group of clients. As an underwriting company, we assess, assume and manage risk with insight and discipline. We service and pay our claims fairly and promptly. The company is also defined by its extensive product and service offerings, broad distribution capabilities, exceptional financial strength and local operations globally. Parent company Chubb Limited is listed on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE: CB) and is a component of the S&P 500 index. Chubb maintains executive offices in Zurich, New York, London, Paris and other locations, and employs approximately 40,000 people worldwide. Additional information can be found at: www.chubb.com .
 



  





 In the Nordics we are an organization of 140 employees.
 



  





**The role purpose** 




  





 Chubb is growing and we are looking for a passionate Technology/Climate technology Underwriter to join our Technology Practice team in the Nordics. In the role as Underwriter, you will focus specifically on Technology and Climate Technology.
 



  





 Are you ready for the next step in your career and would you prefer to take it in a fun and professional team at an international, renowned insurer? Then you are in the right place.
 



  





 This exciting role can suit an Underwriter who is hungry, motivated, inquisitive and in need of a new challenge. We will consider a similar minded hardworking person who feels ready to take the next step in the career.
 



  





 We require someone to develop and assist in underwriting Technology risks. Maintaining and building relationships with our Nordic brokers community with an ambition to write additional new business, which will be key to the success of this role, as well as growing the existing portfolio in line with our agreed growth targets, pricing and retention budget.
 



  





**You make an impact and strengthen our market position by:** 



* Building and maintaining good relationships with brokers.
* Promoting our capabilities and building of a profitable Technology/climate technology portfolio.
* Strong commercial drive, always looking for new opportunities and value service and quality.
* Ensuring quality control by means of including underwriting and peer reviews.
* Representing and promoting Chubb to brokers and clients.
* Delivering strong service to brokers and clients, responding to cross-sell and new business opportunities and monitoring retention.
* Meeting the portfolio product line objectives of the Northern Zone Technology practice team for each underwriting year.



  





**Profile requirements :** 



* Fundamental understanding of and experience from underwriting processes preferably within Technology and Climate Technology
* Degree in Engineering, Computer sciences or business administration or technical / business experience background with an interest for new technologies.
* A strong commercial drive and very customer-oriented approach.
* Experience from client servicing preferably from the insurance industry.
* Demonstrated skills in building and maintaining client relationships preferably from the insurance industry.
* Results driven, disciplined and ambitious with ability to work on own initiative.
* Good communicator and fluent in Swedish (or another Nordic language) and high level of English written as well as spoken.



  





**Why You Want To Work At Chubb** 



* We offer a high-performance work environment in which appreciation and inclusiveness are of paramount importance.
* As an underwriter at Chubb, no two days are the same. You interact with various stakeholders and actively pursue opportunities. Where you do that? From our office in Stockholm, on location during meetings with clients/brokers or from your home office.
* At Chubb, the customer experience is key. With us, insurance is not a static product, but is continuously adapted to the needs of the market.
* As a Chubb employee, you are part of the world's largest publicly traded property and casualty insurance company, providing solutions to businesses of all sizes.
* At Chubb, we operate on the basis of trust. You have a high degree of autonomy, flexibility and also access to a multitude of training and development opportunities.



  





 If you have any questions, please feel free to contact
 **Robin Roos** 
 , Technology Practice Leader for the Northern Zone via:
 ***Tel: + 31 61422 8765 / Robin.Roos@chubb.com.***




 We look forward to hearing from you.

title: Enterprise Data Architect
description:
*Are you a data architecture leader who thrives on bringing structure, clarity, and business value to complex environments? If you're ready to shape how data is governed and used across a fast-moving, pan-Nordic organization we want to talk to you.*
**About The Role**
 As an Enterprise Data Architect at GlobalConnect, you will be instrumental in shaping and implementing the architectural vision for our data and AI landscape. Your knowledge will significantly contribute to generating business value, promoting a culture centered around AI and data, and optimizing existing systems to enhance data quality, governance, and integration to support business processes.
   

  

 You’ll lead cross-functional work on communication, stakeholder alignment, and data security ensuring that architecture decisions are understood, adopted, and resilient. Working across business and IT functions, you will align enterprise data capabilities with strategic goals and support the secure, scalable use of AI.
   

  

 Your focus will be on defining architectures that enable compliance, reliability, and business agility across hybrid and distributed systems. In this pan-Nordic role, you’ll collaborate across borders navigating cultural differences, aligning priorities, and strengthening cohesion across teams.
   

  

 AI enablement is part of your scope, but your primary mission is to ensure that our enterprise data landscape is governed, integrated, and ready to support business innovation including AI.
   

  

**Some of the things you’ll be working on**
* Evaluate and improve the current data landscape identifying opportunities to increase quality, performance, and reliability
* Develop and implement enterprise-wide strategies for master data management, integration, and data quality
* Define and maintain data governance assets including data definitions, business glossaries, data models, and role-based responsibilities to ensure legal compliance and clarity across the organization
* Lead strategic collaboration with IT, security, and business stakeholders to ensure that enterprise data governance and architecture enable scalable AI-aware solutions
* Embed security, compliance, and risk controls into all architectural and data governance frameworks
* Champion data literacy and governance adoption across the organization fostering a shared understanding of data ownership, roles, and responsibilities


**Why Join GlobalConnect**
 You’ll be part of a diverse and highly skilled team based in Northern Europe where collaboration and continuous learning are at the core of our culture. We offer a rare opportunity to shape how we handle data and AI directly contributing to our strategic growth. We at GlobalConnect are making significant strides in the digital transformation of the telecom industry in Northern Europe. This is your chance to be directly involved contribute to innovation and shape the future of data and AI
   

  

**To thrive in this role, we think you have**
* Proven experience in enterprise-level master data management, data governance, and quality improvement
* Exceptional communication skills with the ability to translate technical concepts into business value, build trust with senior stakeholders, and drive alignment across teams and functions
* Expertise in cloud-based distributed data platforms Azure, AWS, or GCP and fluency in tools like Python, DBT, or SQL with the architectural ability to guide platform evolution and data flows across complex systems
* Proven experience designing and guiding the implementation of data-driven architectures at enterprise scale including enabling secure data flows for analytics and AI use cases such as predictive models, NLP or customer scoring


 Do you have the ability to communicate effectively and bridge the gap between technical teams and business stakeholders? Are you motivated to find creative solutions, explore new technologies, and contribute to impactful AI and data projects? If so – we’d be keen to hear from you! We don’t need a personal letter—your CV or LinkedIn profile is enough unless there’s something specific you’d like to explain.
 **Apply now!**

title: Head of Engineering
description:
**Why Join Us?**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. We call this mission Power to Be You. Our assistive communication technology helps our customers express themselves, connect with the world, and pursue independence, whether through everyday activities like ordering food or extraordinary feats like running a company. Working at Tobii Dynavox, you’ll become part of a team that spans the globe, with offices in the US, Sweden, France, the UK, China, and beyond.
   

  

 To learn more about what we make possible, meet some of our customers or take a look at some of our solutions.
   

  

 We’re at an exciting stage in our journey, growing rapidly and expanding our Product & Development team in Stockholm to build a vibrant hub for innovation, product design, and technology. This is a unique opportunity to join a thriving organization where you can help shape the future of assistive communication, defining how we work and delivering impactful solutions for our users.
   

  

 We are building a culture of empowered, collaborative teams who are passionate about helping individuals with disabilities find their voice and connect with the world. Our teams thrive on trust, collaboration, and a positive environment where everyone lead and contributes. We deeply understand the people we serve, empathize with their challenges, and use our expertise to make a real difference.
   

  

 As our
 **Head of Engineering** 
 , you will play a vital role in leading and scaling our engineering organization across software, hardware, and cloud. You will partner closely with product and design leaders to deliver inclusive, high-impact solutions that change lives, and be a key force in shaping the future of our technology, teams, and culture.
   

  

**In this role, you will:**
* Lead, coach, and grow a team of senior engineering managers and a principal architect, fostering a high-performing, psychologically safe, and inclusive environment.
* Drive engineering excellence across architecture, scalability, DevOps, code quality, and reliability.
* Champion collaboration in the Tech/Product/Design (TPD) triad, ensuring strong cross-functional alignment and impact.
* Own and evolve the technical strategy and architectural roadmap to support long-term innovation and business success.
* Ensure high-quality, on-time delivery across all product lines
* Help shape and refine the engineering organization’s operating model, workflows, and metrics.
* Play an active role in talent strategy, hiring, and development to build a diverse, world-class engineering team.
* Contribute to the broader product and business strategy as a trusted advisor to the Chief Product & Development Officer (CPDO) and Product Development leadership.


**What We're Looking For:**
 We are looking for someone who has:
   

  

* A Master’s degree in Computer Science or a related field.
* Extensive experience in product development and engineering leadership.
* A strong track record of building and leading successful product engineering teams.
* Demonstrated success in hiring and nurturing top engineering talent.
* Deep knowledge of software development practices and product architecture.
* Experience aligning technical execution with product and business goals.
* Excellent communication, collaboration, and stakeholder management skills.
* Fluency in both English and Swedish.
* Experience leading organizational transformation is a plus.


**You’ll thrive in this role if you:**
* Are passionate about people, leadership, and purpose-driven product development.
* Are energized by building and scaling high-impact engineering teams.
* Have a deep curiosity about users and a desire to create accessible, empowering solutions.
* Bring a positive, solution-oriented mindset and a strong ability to prioritize and influence.
* Enjoy working in a fast-paced, collaborative environment where learning and growth are continuous.


**Our Values:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, our mission guides what we do, and our values guide us in how we do it. Across the organization, we are committed to being Collaborative, Considerate, Curious and Courageous. We build a trusting environment where every team member prioritizes our customers with empathy and insight. Bold ideas and learning lead to impactful solutions. Driven by curiosity, we continuously challenge the status quo to create meaningful, customer-focused solutions for our customers.
   

  

**What We Offer:**
 At Tobii Dynavox, we believe in empowering individuals – including our employees - to reach their full potential. Here’s what makes us unique:
   

  

* Purpose-Driven Work: Join a company that transforms lives by giving a voice to those with communication challenges. Every day, your work makes a meaningful and concrete impact.
* “Yes, and...” Flexibility: Build a rewarding career AND enjoy time with loved ones. We offer flexible work options so you don’t have to choose between personal and professional goals.
* Growth and Development: Whether you’re advancing your skills or growing your career, we invest in your future with training, learning opportunities, and internal growth paths.
* Inclusive and Supportive Culture: Work in a collaborative, caring environment where diversity and individuality are valued. You’ll feel connected to both your team and our global community.
* A Global Leader with Heart: Be part of an innovative, forward-thinking company that combines experience and cutting-edge solutions with a mission to change lives.

title: Lösningsarkitekt IT utvecklingsstöd & utvecklingsplattformar
description:
Svenska kraftnät är en nyckelaktör i energiomställningen. Vår IT-division växer för att möjliggöra en fördubblad elproduktion och en fossilfri framtid. Med den senaste tekniken ökar vi både infrastrukturens kapacitet och utvecklingstakten inom digitalisering och processer.
   

  

**Om tjänsten**
 Som lösningsarkitekt för området IT-utvecklingsstöd tillhör du enheten Utvecklingsförmågor och verktyg som är en central enhet inom Division IT vars syfte är att hjälpa, stötta och vägleda Svenska kraftnäts utvecklingsteam inom IT-systemutveckling.
   

  

 Detta görs bland annat genom att tillhandahålla centralt förvaltade IT-utvecklingsplattformar och -verktyg såväl som arbetssätt och processer. Ditt arbete blir huvudsakligen att medverka som lösningsarkitekt i vår färdplan och ta fram lösningar för att säkerställa att vi exekverar på målarkitekturen. Ett viktigt arbete är för närvarande att utvärdera och införa nya verktyg och utvecklingsplattformar för att kunna hantera både befintliga och kommande behov inom området.
   

  

 I rollen kommer du bland annat att:
   

  

* Analysera behov (funktionella, icke funktionella) ur såväl strategiskt, taktiskt som operativt perspektiv.
* Leda och driva framtagandet av IT-lösningar relaterade till realisering av en viss förmåga utifrån såväl ett verksamhets- som tekniskt perspektiv och som lever upp till ställda kvalitetskrav.
* Säkerställa att lösningar utformas i enlighet med Svenska kraftnäts målarkitekturerstandarder, arkitektoniska principer och IT-säkerhetsarkitektur samt passar in i vår IT-miljö.
* Kommunicera och förankra rekommenderade lösningar och vägval hos relevanta målgrupper på såväl strategisk nivå som operativ nivå.
* Ansvara för förmågans och underförmågornas arkitektoniska vyer. Exempel på leverabler: scenariobeskrivningar/användningsfall och lösningsdesign (arkitekturbeskrivning).


 Du kommer att spela en nyckelroll i att vidareutveckla vår förmåga inom IT-systemutveckling med särskilt fokus på utvecklingsplattformar och utvecklingsverktyg. Genom att bidra till ökad effektivitet, snabbhet och robusthet i våra applikationer stärker du vår kapacitet att möta framtidens behov. Du stöttar, vägleder och bidrar till samarbetet mellan våra utvecklingsteam för att öka kunskapsdelning och innovation inom Svenska kraftnät och det nordiska och europeiska ekosystem som vi är en del av.
   

  

 Välkommen till ett kompetent team om 16 personer bestående av DevOps-engineers, processledare/metod- och verktygsansvariga, IT-projektledare och förvaltningsledare. Hos oss får du möjlighet att vara med och påverka och utveckla vår förmåga inom IT-systemutveckling. Du delar din vardag med engagerade och kunniga kollegor och verkar i en dynamisk arbetsmiljö där vi strävar efter ständig förbättring.
   

  

**Om dig**
 Skallkrav
   

  

 Vi söker dig som är en strukturerad och drivande person med en arkitektonisk helhetssyn och förmåga att se hur olika delar samverkar i en större kontext. Du är kreativ och lösningsorienterad, kommer gärna med idéer och förslag, och leder lösningsdiskussioner med både tydlighet och öppenhet. Med din relationsskapande och vänliga personlighet skapar du förtroende, bygger samarbeten och är övertygande i din kommunikation - både i tekniska sammanhang och tvärfunktionella grupper.
   

  

 Vi lägger stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 För att vara framgångsrik i rollen krävs en gedigen yrkesbakgrund inom IT-arkitektur och IT-systemutveckling. Du har utbildning från högskola/universitet/yrkeshögskola inom systemvetenskap eller liknande, alternativt motsvarande kompetens som Svenska kraftnät bedömer likvärdig. Du har även:
   

  

* Flerårig arbetslivserfarenhet av att jobba som IT-arkitekt/lösningsarkitekt inom IT-systemutveckling i en större organisation.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av att definiera och leverera IT-lösningar utifrån strategi, affärsprocesser och verksamhetskrav.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet av att leda och driva arkitektrelaterade frågor inom IT-projekt eller IT-förvaltning.
* Arbetslivserfarenhet inom agila arbetssätt.
* God förmåga att uttrycka dig i tal och skrift på svenska och engelska.


 Vi ser det som meriterande om du är certifierad verksamhets- eller IT-arkitekt samt har flerårig aktuell arbetslivserfarenhet av:
   

  

* Arbete inom en samhällskritisk verksamhet alternativt verksamhet med mycket höga säkerhetskrav.
* Testautomatisering
* ITIL
* Verktyg för dokumentation av arkitektur Sparx EA, Visio eller liknande.
* IT-säkerhet, DevSecOps och ISO27000
* Projektstyrning: PPS
* DevOps


**Bra att veta**
* Tjänsten är placerad i Stockholm/Sundbyberg.
* Möjlighet till distansarbete upp till 50 %
* Sista ansökningsdag är 2025-05-08. Vi använder urvalsfrågor istället för personligt brev.
* Tjänsten är en tillsvidareanställning.
* Förmåner | Svenska kraftnät

title: Client Service Partner
company_industry: Financial Services, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Legal Services
description:
**Job Description**
**Title: Client Service Partner**
**Location: Stockholm, Sweden**
**Working Hours: Monday to Friday - 3 days in the office**
*Are you passionate about delivering excellent customer service?*
*We are too!*
 We are currently hiring a
 **Client Service Partner** 
 to support our global clients in a professional business-to-business (B2B) environment in the technology and internet/web services industry. As a Client Service Partner, you will act as the primary point of contact for clients who require assistance with CSC’s internet products and services. You will play a key role in delivering exceptional client service by resolving inquiries, troubleshooting issues and providing clear guidance. You’ll work directly with enterprise B2B clients and will partner with our internal teams at CSC to provide support that will ensure our client’s domain portfolios and digital assets are secure.
   

  

 If you’ve worked in the retail, hospitality & tourism, patient services or restaurant industries, you know what it takes to keep clients happy and satisfied while working in a fast-paced, high-volume environment. Our service professionals are empowered to solve client inquiries and problems quickly and professionally. We provide the training, mentorship, and opportunities for growth. You bring the drive, energy, and commitment to provide world-class service.
   

  

 We’re a company of helpful people teaming up to make a difference in global business and our local communities. We are passionate about service excellence, giving back to the community, and devoted to continuous improvement, CSC is the business behind business®. What does that mean? Learn more about DBS by visiting cscdbs.com . While on that site, navigate to the Customer Tab or the Customer Testimonials section where you will learn about who our clients are and what they have to say about us!
   

  

 Additionally, our positions come with CSC’s competitive benefits and incentives.
   

  

**Some of the tasks you will be responsible for:**
* Client Support: Respond promptly and accurately to client inquiries via multiple communication channels such as chat, telephone, and email. Help customers manage a portfolio of domain names and digital assets to help protect and secure our clients' global internet brands.
* Client Relationships: Build and maintain client relationships by understanding the unique needs of each client.
* Issue Resolution: Troubleshoot and resolve customer order requests and enquiries related to domain names, DNS, digital certificates, digital brand management, billing inquiries, and technical problems. Ensure timely and efficient resolutions to maintain customer satisfaction.
* Escalation Management: Identify and escalate unresolved or complex issues to the appropriate teams, ensuring follow-up and resolution in a timely manner.
* Product Knowledge: Be a trusted partner for your clients by developing and maintaining and in-depth understanding of our services, and to communicate industry changes. and new product offerings.
* Team Collaboration: Assist other teams within DBS with client brand launches and projects, problem-solving, and troubleshooting as needed.
* Performance: Understand and strive to meet or exceed metrics that are designed to help us achieve our industry leading client service support as evidenced by our world-class Net Promoter Score (NPS) results.


**What technical skills, experience, and qualifications do you need?**
* Must be fluent in both English and Swedish. Fluency in German or French would be a plus
* Experience working in a customer-centric environment, industry and/or role
* Effective written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to think critically and be solution oriented
* Strong Microsoft Office skills including MS Excel, Word, and Outlook
* Ability to learn, adapt to, and discuss new technology
* Tenacity and agility to balance varying priorities and inquiries from internal and external customers
* Ability to work independently, as well as on a team
* Proven organizational skills with the ability to prioritize work under pressure in a fast-paced environment
* Previous experience of producing quality results with high attention to detail
* Ability to be direct, open, and honest when communicating with clients and co-workers
* Bilingual skills are a plus


**What You Can Expect From Us**
 Our business is exciting, ever-changing, and highly focused on creating the best client experience. If this sounds like the right fit for you, read on to learn more about how we support our employees as they transition into Digital Brand Services:
   

  

* Professional, engaging, and comprehensive training to introduce our business and the industry, supplemented with on-the-job training
* An on-team mentor to provide additional day to day support during your onboarding
* Collaborative team environment
* Supportive leaders committed to your professional development and growth
* Complimentary access to Open Sesame, monthly job-related recurrent training, and more
* Flexibility for our employees by offering a hybrid work schedule
* A clear vision, mission and values centered around our promise to provide world class service to our clients


**About Us**
 CSC is a global business, legal, and financial services company based in Wilmington, Delaware, USA, providing knowledge-based solutions to clients worldwide. We have offices and capabilities in over 140 jurisdictions in the Americas, Europe, Asia Pacific, and the Middle East, and more than 8,000 colleagues. We are the business behind business.®
   

  

 Visit our careers site to learn more about CSC and our commitment to our clients, communities, and each other.
   

  

 CSC is committed to creating a feeling of belonging through a diverse and growth-oriented environment where everyone is valued.
   

  

 CSC colleagues have global career opportunities and excellent benefits, including annual success-sharing bonuses or commission plans based on individual performance. To learn more, visit cscglobal.com/service/careers .
   

  

 We offer a range of support to colleagues with disabilities, ensuring people have the necessary resources to thrive in their roles. We encourage candidates to work closely with our talent acquisition partners to convey their specific needs. Our commitment to accessibility reflects our broader dedication to diversity and belonging,
   

  

 CSC only accepts resumes from employment agencies that are part of our approved supplier program. Resumes submitted from other agencies either to talent acquisition, our hiring leaders, employees, or through any other mechanism other than our supplier process, will not be eligible to claim related fees and the submitted resumes will be considered property of CSC.
   

  

 We encourage candidates to apply directly to our website and not through third-party sources.
   

  

*Disclaimer: The information above describes the general nature and level of work performed by employees in this role. It is not intended to describe all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications.*
**About The Team**
 At CSC®, we’re always looking ahead, finding ways to improve and anticipate the future needs of our customers. Curiosity fuels our innovation and productivity drives our results. This proactive mindset has helped us adapt and create solutions that have enabled businesses to run smoother and smarter for more than 120 years.
   

  

 CSC is committed to attracting, developing, and retaining talented people whose personal values align with ours. We empower our employees to bring the right solutions to market to meet customer demand. That is why we are the premier provider of global solutions for more than 180,000 businesses.
   

  

* CSC is a great place to work with smart and dedicated people.
* We have been voted a Top Workplace every year since 2006.
* We offer challenging work and career opportunities. Most positions are filled with internal moves and employee referrals.
* Employees are eligible for success sharing, bonus, or commission plans based on role and individual performance.
* CSC offers a competitive and comprehensive benefits package as part of your Total Rewards that includes annual leave, tuition reimbursement, employee referral bonuses, and more.
* As business needs allow, CSC offers hybrid/remote work schedules in alignment with local regulations. Specific details for this position will be discussed during the interview process.

title: Sr. Sales Account Executive
description:
**The Big Picture** 
 We're looking for a sales rockstar to drive strategic enterprise sales for Tungsten Automation Corporation's intelligent automation platform. You'll be orchestrating enterprise deals that make your colleagues jaws drop, helping major enterprises transform their business processes through our unique combination of RPA, cognitive capture, and analytics.
   

  

**What You'll Do**
* Hunt and close new business within your assigned client base
* Build a sales pipeline 4X your target (go big or go home!)
* Orchestrate complex sales cycles with C-suite decision makers
* Cultivate at least 40 strategic relationships per account
* Partner with our lead gen and sales engineering teams
* Turn prospects into raving fans and referenceable clients


**You're Our Person If You Have**
* 5-8 years of crushing it in enterprise software sales
* A track record of consistently exceeding quotas
* Experience selling RPA, SaaS, or automation solutions
* The ability to navigate boardrooms as confidently as Zoom rooms
* A hunter's mindset with a consultant's approach

**The Secret Sauce**
* You're part entrepreneur, part strategist, all closer

**The Fine Print** 
 Our platform is transforming how companies work, and we need someone who's ready to be part of that revolution. The rewards match the challenge - highly competitive compensation for highly competitive people.
   

  

 Ready to help us dominate the intelligent automation space? Game on.
   

  

***Tungsten Automation Corporation, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disability/Vets***

title: Rekryterare
description:

 Vi söker nu en rekryteringsspecialist med IT-kompetens till offentlig myndighet
   

  

 Uppdragsperiod: 1 september 2025 – 31 januari 2026

 Uppdraget innebär operativt och strategiskt stöd till IT-avdelningen i rekrytering, konsultupphandling och konsultväxling. Arbetsinsatsen kan variera under perioden utifrån behov och fas i processen.
